00024 void Wave :: waveRead (char * filename) {
00025         long temp;      // temp variable for file stream cursor position
00026 
00027         // open .wav file, exit if error occured
00028         if(!(pointerWaveFile = fopen (filename, "rb")))
00029         {
00030                 printf ("Can't open file %s\n", filename);
00031                 exit (0);
00032         }
00033 
00034         // read RIFF header confirmation tag
00035         fseek (pointerWaveFile, OFFSET_CHUNK_ID, SEEK_SET);
00036         fread (ChunkID, sizeof (ChunkID), 1, pointerWaveFile);
00037         // exit if RIFF tag not found
00038         if (memcmp (ChunkID, _HEADER, sizeof (ChunkID)))
00039         {
00040                 printf ("\nFormat mismatch : File not RIFF %s \n", _HEADER);
00041         exit (0);
00042         }
00043 
00044         // read (WAVE header + PCM data) size
00045         fread (&ChunkSize, sizeof (ChunkSize), 1, pointerWaveFile);
00046         fseek (pointerWaveFile, 0L, SEEK_END);
00047         // exit if (header + data) size mismatch with physical file size
00048         if ((temp = ftell (pointerWaveFile)) != (ChunkSize + 8))
00049         {
00050                 printf ("\nCorrupt file : Incorrect file size\n");
00051                 exit (0);
00052         }
00053 
00054         // read WAVE fonfirmation tag
00055         fseek (pointerWaveFile, OFFSET_FORMAT, SEEK_SET);
00056         fread (Format, sizeof (Format), 1, pointerWaveFile);
00057         // exit if WAVE tag not found
00058         if (memcmp (Format, _CHUNK, sizeof (Format)))
00059         {
00060                 printf ("\nFormat mismatch : File not .WAV\n");
00061                 exit (0);
00062         }
00063 
00064         // read and confirm header chunk tag
00065         fread (SubChunk1ID, sizeof (SubChunk1ID), 1, pointerWaveFile);
00066         if (memcmp (SubChunk1ID, _SUB_CHUNK_1, sizeof (SubChunk1ID)))
00067         {
00068                 printf ("\nFormat mismatch : No header chunk present\n");
00069                 exit (0);
00070         }
00071 
00072         // read and confirm header chunk size
00073         // PCM encoded file header size = 16
00074         fread (&SubChunk1Size, sizeof (SubChunk1Size), 1, pointerWaveFile);
00075         if (SubChunk1Size != _SUB_CHUNK_1_SIZE)
00076         {
00077                 printf ("\nFormat mismatch : Only PCM files valid 1\n");
00078                 exit (0);
00079         }
00080 
00081         // read audio format code
00082         fread (&AudioFormat, sizeof (AudioFormat), 1, pointerWaveFile);
00083         // exit if audio format != PCM format code
00084         if (AudioFormat != _AUDIO_FORMAT) //change
00085         {
00086                 printf ("\nFormat mismatch : Only PCM files valid 2\n");
00087                 exit (0);
00088         }
00089 
00090         // read number of channels in audio file
00091         fread (&NumChannels, sizeof (NumChannels), 1, pointerWaveFile);
00092 
00093         // read sample rate of PCM
00094         fread (&SampleRate, sizeof (SampleRate), 1, pointerWaveFile);
00095 
00096     // read block size for each sample, all channels combined
00097     fseek (pointerWaveFile, OFFSET_BLOCK_ALIGN, SEEK_SET);
00098     fread (&BlockAlign, sizeof (BlockAlign), 1, pointerWaveFile);
00099 
00100         // read sample resolution of PCM
00101         fseek (pointerWaveFile, OFFSET_BITS_PER_SAMPLE, SEEK_SET);
00102         fread (&BitsPerSample, sizeof (BitsPerSample), 1, pointerWaveFile);
00103         // exit if sample resolution is not 16 bits
00104         if (BitsPerSample != _BITS_PER_SAMPLE)
00105         {
00106                 printf ("\nFormat mismatch : Incorrect PCM resolution\n");
00107                 exit (0);
00108         }
00109 
00110         // read and confirm data chunk tag
00111         fread (SubChunk2ID, sizeof (SubChunk2ID), 1, pointerWaveFile);
00112         if (!strcmp (SubChunk2ID, _SUB_CHUNK_2))
00113         {
00114                 printf ("\nFormat mismatch : No data chunk present\n");
00115                 exit (0);
00116         }
00117 
00118         // read data chunk size
00119         fread (&SubChunk2Size, sizeof (SubChunk2Size), 1, pointerWaveFile);
00120         // exit if data chunk size != filesize - total header size
00121         if ((SubChunk2Size + OFFSET_DATA) != temp)
00122         {
00123                 printf ("\nCorrupt file : Incorrect amount of data\n");
00124                 exit (0);
00125         }
00126 
00127         // calculate number of samples per channel in the file
00128         NumSamplesPerChannel = (SubChunk2Size * 8) / (NumChannels * BitsPerSample);
00129 
00130     pointerWaveFile = pointerWaveFile;
00131 
00132 } // end of waveRead
00133 
00143 void Wave :: waveLoad (long startSampleIndex, long numSamples, short * data) {
00144     if (startSampleIndex + numSamples <= NumSamplesPerChannel)
00145     {
00146         fseek (pointerWaveFile, OFFSET_DATA + (BlockAlign * startSampleIndex), SEEK_SET);
00147         fread (data, sizeof (short), numSamples * NumChannels, pointerWaveFile);
00148     }
00149     else
00150     {
00151         printf ("\nIncorrect Sample Index\n");
00152         exit (0);
00153     }
00154 }
00155 
00159 void Wave :: waveClose () {
00160     fclose (pointerWaveFile);
00161 }
00162 
00168 void Wave :: waveWrite (const char * filename, short * data) {
00169 
00170 }

00175 void Wave :: waveDownmix (short * data, short * dataDownMix) {
00176     long i;
00177     if (NumChannels == 2) // supports only stereo and mono. Does not still support surround sound
00178     {
00179         for (i = 0; i < NumSamplesPerChannel; i ++)
00180         {
00181             dataDownMix [i]= (data [2 * i] / 2) + (data [(2 * i) + 1] / 2);
00182         }
00183     }
00184     else if (NumChannels == 1)
00185     {
00186         dataDownMix = data;
00187     }
00188 } // end of MFCCdownmix

00193 short Wave :: getNumChannels () {
00194     return NumChannels;
00195 }
00196 
00200 long Wave :: getNumSamplesPerChannel () {
00201     return NumSamplesPerChannel;
00202 }

00207 long Wave ::  getSampleRate () {
00208     return SampleRate;
